column4: I have set up samba to share my drives (using Ubuntu as a NAS) and see my /home/user/ folder is shared on the network (can only browse, not change files) - how do I make it so that this folder is not shared? when I go to /home/ and right-click /user/ and view Sharing Options, the "Share this folder" option is unticked
What?
You've set up samba to share your drives?
How do you make it so that *what* folder is not shared?
well, not the drives directly... but the first folder in the drives are shared... but the problem is that /home/user/ is also shared, I don't want to share that
What *do* you want to share?
What do you mean "the first folder in the drives"?
I do want to share my drives with media on, and have already done so, the problem is that my /home/ folder is also shared, and I don't want that
Well, it appears that is exactly what you've shared.
so to have any shared folder at all, I need to share my whole home directory?
Ok then, just share what you want to and not what you don't want to.  NO, you do NOT have to share your whole home directory.
again, I do _not_ want to share my home dir, but it is shared, and I am asking how to un-share it, since when I click on Sharing Options for the folder the sharing checkboxes are un-ticked
First, you have to figure out exactly what you've done.  Well, back up and decide exactly what you *want* to do.  Make a directory that you want to share and then just share only that.
pastebinit /etc/samba/smb.conf
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1126326/
Yep, you shared your home folder.    Now, what do you really want to share?
See lines 342-347 ?
I only want to share the other drives connected to it, and I have done so successfully... thanks for your help
Suggestion, create a folder, like maybe "Videos".  Then just share /home/platypus/Videos
What you did instead is to share your entire home directory.
I'm running Ubuntu as a NAS, booting from a USB thumbdrive, and only share the 10 internal drives on it
That is now what your smb.conf file says.
removing and chanign a few lines in the conf resolved it, thanks
Okeydokey
